sect2.title: System requirements
sect2.para: This Plug-in requires Eclipse 2.0. It may or may not work with prior or later builds. See for the basic requirements to run Jalopy.
To obtain more information about this powerful IDE, visit the official Eclipse homepage: http://www.eclipse.org/

sect2.title: Installation
sect2.para: The Plug-in comes either as a single .zip or compressed .tar archive. Unzipping either one of these files into a directory of your choice (referred to as <INST_DIR>) will produce two subdirectories /bin and /docs.

Copy the de.hunsicker.jalopy.plugin.eclipse_version folder from /bin into your Eclipse plugin folder and restart Eclipse. That's all there is to it, you are now ready to run Jalopy from within Eclipse.

sect2.title: Main menu bar
sect2.para: Currently, the software adds a new item into the main menu bar of Eclipse to launch the Jalopy settings dialog. Note that the this configuration dialog is actually a Java Swing dialog launched in-process so the appearance and behaviour may slightly differ compared to native applications. A future version will bring tightly integration with the Eclipse workbench preferences dialog.

listitem.para: Displays the Jalopy settings dialog. Use this item if you want to change the settings that control the layout of any formatted code.

sect2.para:
The menu item appears only for certain views/editors. If you want to enable it permanently, mark
Window Customize Perspective... Action Sets Jalopy

sect2.title: Java Editor context menu
sect2.para: The software adds a new menu item to the context menu of Java editors.

listitem.para: Formats the contents of the editor.

sect2.title: Project, Folder, File context menus
sect2.para: The software adds a new menu item to the context menu of projects, folders and Java source files in the navigation view of the Java perspective.

listitem.para: Formats the selected files. Depending on the object type (project, folder, file) formats either all Java source files of the project, the contents of the selected folder(s) (including subfolders) or the currently selected Java source file(s).
